description: 本課程旨在加深學生的英語能力，結合與科學及科技等相關主題規劃英語授課內容，期透過主題式課程增進學生興趣並提升英語基本能力及學術應用可能。
goals: 1. 增進學生英語溝通表達能力 2. 透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神 3. 透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野 4. 透過課堂討論培養批判精神 5. 提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
**Objectives**: This course is designed to support students in their use of Science English language and to **improve their proficiency** through intensive and extensive skill/strategy training. This class also aims to **build up students’ proficiency** **in** all four language skills—**reading, listening, speaking and writing** —through a series of activities and tasks. In order to do so, there a **three-pronged approach** to the course:

**1)** Firstly, there will be **no course textbook!** In groups of four, the students will be responsible for **choosing an article, video or other material** for each class under the general theme of science, and inform the teacher more than a week before the class. Then on the day itself the group will give a **short PPT summarizing the main points** of their chosen material. They will also have made a **comprehension and discussion worksheet** on the material to be followed by **an activity or a game**.

**2)** Secondly, over the first-half of the semester, students will undertake a major **task-based project**, in which task groups, of no more than 4 students per group, are asked to **prepare an experiment in an area or topic** that are **of interest to them**, and then **present their work** to the class **via film or live performance**.

**3)** Thirdly, over the course of the first-half of the semester, students will undertake a **writing workshop**, in which students are asked to **investigate and write about areas and topics** that have been taught throughout the course

**4)** Furthermore, students should **compile a portfolio in their notebooks** outlining all the English-language experiences they have had during the semester. This includes real-life experiences and online work. **Proof of any autonomous work** is mandatory.

**All elements** of the course **will be evaluated and assessed** when calculating the final grade.

**Materials:** **No Textbook!** A **Notebook is necessary** for taking notes on new vocabulary, phrases, grammar, task project, autonomous work and homework assignments.

**Guidelines and Requirements: The Ten Commandments!**

1.  Punctual attendance is essential for this class. **Talk to or email me** if you can’t attend class.
2.  The material for this class is mostly prepared by the students. These **articles/materials must be handed in a week early** for the class to work properly.
3.  **Actively participate** in class discussions.
4.  **Grades will be downgraded** for failure to attend class without reason, excessive lateness, lack of participation or failure to do homework. 
5.  You need to **submit** homework **_several times_** during the semester.
6.  **Task** assignments and homework **must** be done and be **on time**.
7.  , tablets, etc, must be **turned off** unless needed in class.
8.  **No eating** during class, but **drinks are allowed**.
9.  ou **are advised to visit the English Chat Room** (Gongguan Library **A107** or Main Campus **樸****102**) as much as you can.
10.   **English Practice:** Students **should** **practice their English** every chance they get. Any English-language encounters can be recorded in your Class Journal for **grading**!

**Grading Policy****:** **The Business!**

Final Grades are based and assessed on student performances as follows:

1.  Attendance and Participation: 10%
2.  Student Lesson: 20% (Presentation 10%, materials: 10%)
3.  Quizzes (x2): 20%
4.  Experiment Task: 20% (Presentation: 10%, drafts and reflection: 10%)
5.  Essays/movie review: 20%
6.  Autonomous learning: 20%
